description.narrative: Main Objective a) assist the electoral management body (EMB) in becoming a more capable, transparent and ultimately, trusted institution; and b) providing the required assistance necessary for undertaking inclusive, transparent and credible elections.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: # of studies/assessments produced. Output 2: NEBE’s outreach capacity and public image improved Indicators: # of structures/facilities established to enhance interaction with media # of operational website/interface platforms.

comment.narrative: NEBE’s decision-making strengthen through evidence and analysis Baseline: Limited evidence base existing as regards to new and innovative practices in elections management. Output 2: NEBE’s outreach capacity and public image improved Baseline: No operational website; No media center; Limited in-house capacity to engage with media; manuals on engagement with media and public.

Output 1: NEBE’s decision-making strengthen through evidence and analysis Targets: 15 recommendations and improvement options, out of which 5 focused on gender equality and inclusion 3 studies/assessments. Output 2: NEBE’s outreach capacity and public image improved Targets: 1 media center established 1 website created.

Output 1: • 21 draft directives and one draft manual were produced in 2019 according to Proclamation 1162/2019. SEEDS participated in 6 consultations to explain the new legislation and to discuss best way of the implementation. • A procurement plan was developed in Dec2019 for approval by the SEEDS Project Board. • Technical specifications developed and an international procurement launched for voter registration materials. • A comprehensive operational plan developed though an electoral timeline had not yet been finalized. • A feasibility Study for biometric voter registration was undertaken which informed decisions made by NEBE to conduct paper registration process. • An assessment of the existing Result Management System was completed.
Output 2: • NEBE initiated development of external communication strategy. • Between Oct-Dec2019, NEBE held at least 10 meetings with key stakeholders in electoral processes. • 2 press conferences were held by NEBE in late Nov2019. • During the Sidama referendum, NEBE held at least 3 meetings with officials, elders, and CSOs to discuss the prevention of electoral violence. • A draft public outreach strategy was developed.
Output 3: • 2 national electoral risk mappings were conducted in Mar2019 and Aug2019. • 1 focused electoral risk mapping was conducted in Nov2019. • A monitoring framework was designed that relies on assessment of structural and proximate causes, intervening factors, triggers and history of violence. • A Joint Electoral Operations Centre (JEOC) was established during the Sidama referendum to test the concept proposed for the prevention of electoral violence. No major security incidents marred the referendum and NEBE expressed satisfaction on the functioning of the JEOC. The test JEOC was informed by baseline electoral risk mapping and analysis conducted by SEEDS.

Output 1 Increased credibility as reported by domestic and international observers Number of consultations to explain the new legislation Number of regulatory and procedural instruments developed A comprehensive operational plan is developed Number of women in voter registration processes The number of poling staff trained in conduct of election operations
Output 2 Number of NEBE external communication plans developed. Number of press releases and media engagement platforms organized Number of trainings conducted by NEBE for political parties Number of candidates/political parties registered Printed and audio-visual CVE materials are produced and disseminated by NEBE Output 3 Number of violent conflicts in the election period reported through the Early Warning System A responsive, efficient, and credible NEBE-based monitoring and early response system is designed and implemented Number of Conflict prevention and management trainings conducted

Output 1 Increased credibility reported by AU but not so by IRI_NDI 34 consultations organized to explain the new legislation 22 directives developed 03 comprehensive operational plans developed Around 49% women registered as voters 250,000 poling staff trained in conduct of election operations
Output 2 04 external communication strategies developed 34 media engagement platforms organized 23 trainings conducted by NEBE for political parties 52 political parties registered and 8,209 candidiates 11 PSAs developed and disseminated by NEBE Output 3 85 violent conflicts in the election period reported through the Early Warning System A responsive, efficient, and credible NEBE-based monitoring and early response system developed 12 Conflict prevention and management trainings conducted

Output1: • NEBE branches/offices at constituency level and polling stations established. • Poling staffs are trained in conduct of election operations including polling and counting procedures. • Digitization of voters’ roll implemented and relevant trainings are conducted with focus on gender equality. • Gender disaggregated voter registration data and voter turnout data available. • Voting material efficiently procured and delivered in Addis and throughout the country. • 75% of IDPs registered as voters • Compilation of observers reports, recommendations, lessons-learned disseminated/published.
Output 2: • NEBE communication and external relations capacity improved. • The public outreach strategies, operational plans and public outreach material produced and implemented. • Electoral stakeholders informed and trained.
Output 3: • A NEBE-based electoral violence monitoring and early response system is implemented. • Violent conflicts in the election period will be reported.

• NEBE branches/offices at 646 constituencies established and 75 zonal offices. • Poling staffs training was pushed into 2021 becaue of delay in elections • Digitization of voters’ roll implemented and relevant trainings moved to 2021 • Gender disaggregated voter registration data and voter turnout data to be made available in 2021. • Procurement of voter registration kits, voter books, ballot boxes, voting screens and ICT equipment completed. • Data on IDPs collected through IOM • Election delayed till 2021.
Output 2: • NEBE communication and external relations capacity improved through provision of technical assistance • Voter education strategy developed and implementaion plan formulated. • Electoral stakeholders training moved to 2021
Output 3: • Work started on development of a NEBE-based electoral violence monitoring and early response system. • Reporting of conflicts delayed because of elections in 2021.
